headline: Starbucks feels the heat as more chains compete for US coffee drinkers
summary: Americans are drinking more coffee than they have in decades.  The company that revolutionized U.S. coffee culture remains America's biggest player, with nearly 17,000 U.S. stores and plans to open hundreds more.  Starbucks’ share of spending at all U.S. coffee shops fell in 2024 and 2025; it now stands at 48%, down from 52% in 2023, according to Technomic, a food industry consulting firm.

thumbnail.caption: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer Mike Grams speaks during the Starbucks Investor Day event, with an image of the company's Mastrena 3 espresso machine, in New York, Thursday, Jan. 29, 2026. (AP Photo/Richard Drew)
